intro: Cnidium silaus var. angustifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved cnidium, is a perennial herb native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often pungent odor. The plant typically features slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctively hairy surface. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the family, and it produces small, dry fruits. It is often found in moist, shaded environments and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
